text: This pavilion is dedicated to our National flower Vada Miss Joaquim but it has very few orchids. Nonetheless, a very pleasant place to rest your feet while exploring the Tanjong Pagar area.
Quaint area with seating spaces under shade near Tanjong Pagar market.

Am here because Hakata Ikkousha ramen long queue. LOL. Nice lil' garden to sit & wait. Pretty windy here so it helps with the heat. There's a sculpture erected here as well marking this place as "vanda miss joaquim pavilion" that was officially opened on 17 Apr 2002 by Tanjong Pagar GRC MP Assoc. Prof. Koo Tsai Kee.
Just a pavilion next to traffic light. Crossed over is the one whole stretch of Korean Restaurant
Nice place to commemorate our national flower. 5/5 will visit again
